name: Color Theory (TaLcGames)
description: I strongly recommend a mouse, and make sure to go fullscreen for the web verison. The Game Color Theory is a fast paced game about joining the primary colors together in order to get the secondary colors, and absorb as many colorful blobs as you can! There is a red screen flash so be wary if you are sensitive to that.  The three primary colors spawn randomly around the map for you to collect, and every time you touch one of them you either gain their color or mix it with your current one.  There will always be three enemies pursuing you around the map, and when they get close enough they will try to dash on top of you. Defeat them by matching your own color with theirs and absorb them! Some Context This is my first solo game in Unity, and since it slipped my mind the GMTK Game Jam was this weekend, I hadn't prepared at all. I was lucky I had notifications on for the YT as I saw the theme get announced.  The connection with the theme might be a slight stretch but my thought process ended up with me thinking of "joining colors" as everything else I came up with was way too complicated for me to attempt. Most of my time making the game was spent learning how to code in C# as I already had some experience with using Unity. As a result, I didn't get everything I wanted in (like cool animations) but the gameplay idea is there. Hope you enjoy! I got the sound from this asset pack.
